metadata.title: CVE-2017-12982 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description: The bmp_read_info_header function in bin/jp2/convertbmp.c in OpenJPEG 2.2.0does not reject headers with a zero biBitCount, which allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (memory allocation failure) in theopj_image_create function in lib/openjp2/image.c, related to theopj_aligned_alloc_n function in opj_malloc.c.

criterions.comment: openjpeg2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
openjpeg: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was not-affected').
